TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
And you just retextured Lack's models?

The current models are technically made from scratch, but were made based on sizings and positions of Lack's models.

...Why the sad face?

Hmmmm, I may give the HGR 1.875m engines a try in that case, see if they fit the bill.

They also are probably a very good fit!

Heatshield and Fairing.

Edited November 1, 2015 by Beale
Inevitably revamped? When will that be?

Inevitably revamped? When will that be?

Had to search for what you were talking about... it seems that Porkjet has turned his eyes towards the stock rocket parts (not just the airplane parts) and so we might see the rocket parts be brought more into line with his art style. So eventually the Mk1-2 pod will probaby get redone.
May I see a pic of it?

May I see a pic of it?

Uh... well, he probably hasn't started yet. As far as we know.
Oh. My bad I misread, I thought you said you had pics. My bad.
Whenever I try to install this mod with realism overhaul, KSP freezes on loading once it reaches the Tantares parts. Has anybody had this issue before?

So Beale, if you're not going to make an IVA? What's the diameter of your pod?

- - - Updated - - -

Will it be interchangeable? Because that would at least be a good substitute.
I like the white color scheme on new capsule. Would it have some new manufacturer?

Whenever I try to install this mod with realism overhaul, KSP freezes on loading once it reaches the Tantares parts. Has anybody had this issue before?

Can you tell which part exactly it is stalling on? That can tell much

So Beale, if you're not going to make an IVA? What's the diameter of your pod?

Will it be interchangeable? Because that would at least be a good substitute.

By default, everything new is getting an IVA so I will not forget. Older parts will get internals eventually (may be easier in 1.0.5 also).

I like the white color scheme on new capsule. Would it have some new manufacturer?

Thanks!

Cannot say for a new manufacturer. I guess the same manufacturer as TKS, whatever that is.
So....what are you planning on putting in the bottom of the lander?

So....what are you planning on putting in the bottom of the lander?

A heat shield with landing legs, something like so:

Engines will likely be radial-mounted.

Underneath all this: possibly a descent stage, It really depends on, the Mars mission based around ISRU? So land empty on a single stage and fill up again?

+ Or, descent stage for slow down, "ascent" stage for hover + landing + ascent.

+ Or, descent stage for slow down, hover, landing and ascent stage for... ascent.

Something like this:

Personally, I am a fan of the first option (ISRU architecture), but there are options...

The big question will be how do you maintain flight stability in both directions?

The big question will be how do you maintain flight stability in both directions?

With gimbals that the gods themselves will envy.

But, really I think it will be not so big of a problem, on Duna.

On Eve/Kerbin/Laythe... Good question.

Can you tell which part exactly it is stalling on? That can tell much

Ok, here is my KSP log: https://www.dropbox.com/s/sfwmswp61l0ibtj/KSP.log?dl=0 (Extremely long due to RO, only look near the end.)

I also have a picture of my GameData: http://imgur.com/i7hZyT0

My Computer has been acting strange recently, so that also might be the problem.

With gimbals that the gods themselves will envy.

But, really I think it will be not so big of a problem, on Duna.

On Eve/Kerbin/Laythe... Good question.

Maybe keep the radial engines above the center of mass? any deviation from the flight path by aerodynamic forces would angle the thrusters to push it back on course under most circumstances right?

Thanks a lot for all your guys' work on this MOD. I am very much enjoying it but i have a question. Am I doing something wrong? The rockets seem to be WAY overpowered. I am getting a soyuz type rocket into orbit in almost a single stage, which is to say i am separating the boosters right before reaching APO. In this design i have also removed the usual SOYUZ 3rd stage. With a PROTON type rocket, I AM getting to orbit with about 5% fuel remaining in the 1st stage!!!

Take a look at the "soviet space program career" mod in my sig - the configs it comes with provide a variety of edits/fixes to the parts to make them more balanced. For example, building a copy of the original sputnik rocket will only be able to put a very small payload into low Kerbin orbit, the Proton cannot get you all the way to Duna anymore, the full-stack Soyuz rocket no longer gets you to the Mun, etc etc.
I have a question, What happened to that soyuz texture revamp?

Ok, here is my KSP log: https://www.dropbox.com/s/sfwmswp61l0ibtj/KSP.log?dl=0 (Extremely long due to RO, only look near the end.)

I also have a picture of my GameData: http://imgur.com/i7hZyT0

My Computer has been acting strange recently, so that also might be the problem.

Thanks!

I'll take a look when I have a chance.

Maybe keep the radial engines above the center of mass? any deviation from the flight path by aerodynamic forces would angle the thrusters to push it back on course under most circumstances right?

This could work yeah. Alternatively (much worse) control surfaces.

What can be said is the craft will be bottom-heavy for sure.

I have a question, What happened to that soyuz texture revamp?

What are you asking?
